explanation: The report is correct. The code calls strlen(value) without first ensuring that value is a valid, NUL-terminated, non-NULL string. strlen scans memory until it finds a NUL byte, so if the caller passes NULL or a non-NUL-terminated buffer this will read beyond the bounds of the object (or dereference NULL), which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 unless there is an external, provable precondition guaranteeing value is non-NULL and NUL-terminated. The rest of the string.h uses (memcmp) are protected by explicit size checks, but the strlen usage is unguarded. Fixes: document/ enforce the precondition, or check value != NULL and use a bounded length (e.g. strnlen with an appropriate maximum) or otherwise ensure the call cannot read out of bounds.
